change.li: $Log: encyclopedia.xml,v $ Revision 1.28 2006/03/27 14:02:23 gcrane more refinements Revision 1.27 2006/03/26 04:13:20 gcrane more fixes Revision 1.26 2006/03/25 19:26:47 gcrane more fixes Revision 1.25 2006/03/25 16:38:06 gcrane Did a lot of work to clean up the base headers for subentries. These should more often now only include global descriptions, e.g, PERSON, son of A stays, but PERSON, fought at Troy goes. --> "Fought at Troy" can be one of many events and is not a global identifier Revision 1.24 2006/03/20 19:15:42 gcrane cleaned up the formatting Revision 1.23 2006/03/20 14:15:22 gcrane small changes Revision 1.20 2006/03/18 15:34:36 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.19 2006/03/18 01:14:23 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.18 2006/03/17 23:55:18 gaweaver small fixes Revision 1.17 2006/03/17 21:56:39 gaweaver Calliopi From Antiphon until Chilon Revision 1.16 2006/03/17 15:39:04 gaweaver no message Revision 1.15 2006/03/10 00:01:20 gaweaver changes made by GRC while over the atlantic Revision 1.14 2006/03/05 03:47:42 gcrane base file Revision 1.13 2006/03/04 13:13:03 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.12 2006/03/03 18:21:05 gaweaver Agenor (10) Revision 1.11 2006/02/15 16:24:46 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.10 2006/02/13 21:52:23 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.9 2006/02/13 01:57:42 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.8 2006/02/12 23:12:05 gcrane small fixes Revision 1.7 2006/02/12 15:30:08 gcrane major structural update: the descriptive info has now been moved up into the headers and id's added to div1 type="entry" Revision 1.6 2006/02/12 13:23:59 gcrane moved descriptions up into the header: the goal is to make the header more informative and thus to facilitate the mechanics of aligning entries in this list with those in Smith's etc Revision 1.5 2006/02/11 19:49:21 gcrane more small fixes to make the coding consistent Revision 1.4 2006/02/11 18:50:04 gcrane working towards moving identifiers for all entities up into the subentry HEAD Revision 1.3 2006/02/10 22:43:14 gcrane changed the structure so that every entry has a subentry -- this simplifies the structure (i hope) Revision 1.2 2005/08/18 13:53:45 packel item tags... Revision 1.1 2005/07/25 14:32:52 packel Converted to XML Revision 1.34 2003/07/01 22:16:05 yorkc Updated texts to TEI P4 and Perseus P4 extensions; minor cleanup (esp. character encodings and typos.) Revision 1.33 2000/03/16 03:17:12 dasmith Gave homonym entries a top-level header. Revision 1.32 2000/03/16 02:52:18 dasmith Added alphabetic letter DIV0s. Made entries subordinate to alphabetic letters in refsDecl. Revision 1.31 2000/03/15 15:12:45 amahoney make homonyms sub-entries Revision 1.30 2000/03/14 18:11:05 amahoney several more random issues, but the Apollodorus refs really are right now Revision 1.27 2000/03/04 20:34:25 dasmith Added separate funder entity to TEI header. Revision 1.26 2000/02/22 17:17:30 amahoney fix bibl refs to known works Revision 1.25 2000/02/04 17:58:05 dasmith Primary lookup by ID (mostly useful for internal navigation). Revision 1.24 2000/01/10 21:09:41 acsmith trying again to change pilaster def. Revision 1.23 2000/01/10 20:16:54 dasmith Fixed sentence grammar. Revision 1.22 1999/10/01 14:11:04 acsmith Amy did away with dangling ref. to Type A2 cup, and turned all Type A1 cups into Type A cups, and lower cased type in Proto type A cup. Revision 1.21 1999/09/30 21:52:22 dasmith Fixed amphorae cross-refs. Revision 1.20 1999/09/30 21:08:38 acsmith ACS fixed (hopefully!) amphorae and pyxides Revision 1.19 1999/09/29 15:55:28 dasmith Converted to TEI2 tagging.

div2.subhead: Dactyls, IdaeanD. or Curetes entrusted with care of infant Zeus

ul.li: Herakles one of them: Paus. 8.31.3, Paus. 9.19.5, Paus. 9.27.8

div2.subhead: Dadicae, a people in the N.E. of the Persian empire

div3.p: The lower portion of a wall, between the baseboard and any higher decorative moldings, which is frequently painted or sculpted.

ul.li: Great D., festival held by Boeotians: Paus. 9.3.5-8

div2.subhead: Daedalum, image of oak-wood made for festival of Daedala

ul.li: belongs to royal house of Athens: Paus. 7.4.5
master of Scyllis and Dipoenus: Paus. 2.15.1, and of Clearchus: Paus. 3.17.6
makes a statue of Herakles at Pisa: Apollod. 2.6.3
architect, banished from Athens for murder of Calos: Apollod. 3.1.3; Paus. 1.21.4, Paus. 1.26.4
resides with Minos at Cnosus: Paus. 7.4.5, Paus. 8.53.8
makes an artificial cow for Pasiphae: Apollod. 3.1.3
son of Eupalamus, architect and first inventor of images: Apollod. 3.15.8
tried and condemned in the Areopagus: Apollod. 3.15.8
besought by Ariadne to disclose the way out of the labyrinth: Apollod. 2.1.3
shut up by Minos in the labyrinth: Apollod. 2.1.4
makes wings for himself and flies to Camicus in Sicily: Apollod. 2.1.4, Apollod. 2.1.5
pursued and detected by Minos: Apollod. 2.1.5
escapes from Crete to Cocalus in Sicily: Paus. 1.21.4, Paus. 7.4.6, Paus. 9.11.4ff.
his fame spread over Sicily and Italy: Paus. 7.4.7
thought by some to have colonised Sardinia with Aristaeus: Paus. 10.17.4
his works uncouth but inspired: Paus. 2.4.5
list of his works: Paus. 1.27.1, Paus. 2.4.5, Paus. 8.16.3, Paus. 8.35.2, Paus. 8.46.2, Paus. 9.11.4, Paus. 9.39.8, Paus. 9.40.3ff.
a Sicyonian sculptor: Paus. 6.2.8, Paus. 6.3.4, 7, Paus. 6.6.1, Paus. 10.9.6

div2.subhead: Damagetus, king of Ialysus in Rhodes

ul.li: a Parrhasian, Olympic victor, turned into wolf at sacrifice of Lycaean Zeus: Paus. 6.8.2

div2.subhead: Damasichthon, son of Amphion and Niobe
Damasithymus, a Carian officer in Xerxes' fleet

ul.li: king of the Calyndians, in Xerxes' fleet at Salamis: Hdt. 8.87
slain by Theseus: Apollod. E.1.3, Apollod. E.1.4
a suitor for Cleisthenes' daughter: Hdt. 6.127
marches with Herakles against Augeas: Paus. 6.20.16

div2.subhead: Damia, a deity worshipped in Aegina and Epidaurus

ul.li: disputes claim of Aristodemus to throne: Paus. 4.10.5
a Sicyonian sculptor, pupil of Pison: Paus. 6.3.5
Olympic victor: Paus. 4.27.9, Paus. 6.5.3, Paus. 7.25.4, Paus. 8.27.8
son of Euctemon, leads Phocians to Asia: Paus. 7.2.4, Paus. 7.3.10
kills his adversary at Nemean games: Paus. 8.40.3-5
shut up in a brazen chamber: Apollod. 2.3.2, Apollod. 2.4.1
cast into sea and drifts with Perseus to Seriphus: Apollod. 2.4.1
returns with Perseus to Argos: Apollod. 2.4.3
mother of Perseus, daughter of Acrisius: Hdt. 2.1, Hdt. 6.53, Hdt. 7.61, Hdt. 7.150

div2.subhead: Danai, old name of the Argives
Danaus, his legendary migration to Greece from Chemmis in Egypt

ul.li: with his daughters lands in Argolis: Paus. 2.38.4, Paus. 4.35.2
the first to build a ship: Apollod. 2.1.4
flees with his daughters to Argos and obtains the kingdom from Gelanor: Apollod. 2.1.4; Paus. 2.16.1, Paus. 2.19.3
consents to marry his daughters to the sons of Egyptus: Apollod. 2.1.4, Apollod. 2.1.5, Apollod. 2.1.5
his daughters murder their husband cousins: Apollod. 2.1.5; Paus. 2.16.1
gives his daughters to victors in an athletic contest: Apollod. 2.1.5; Paus. 3.12.2
dedicates sanctuary and image of Wolfish Apollo: Paus. 2.19.3ff.
dedicates pedestal adorned with reliefs: Paus. 2.19.7
his daughters dedicate image of Aphrodite: Paus. 2.37.2
frenzied: of the mad daughters of Proetus: Apollod. 2.2.2
of Lacedaemonian maidens at Caryae in honour of Artemis: Paus. 3.10.7, Paus. 4.16.9
of Magnesians wrought on throne of Apollo: Paus. 3.18.14
of Spartan lads in honour of Apollo: Paus. 3.11.9
wrought on shield of Achilles: Paus. 8.16.3
flows with equal volume in summer and winter: Paus. 8.38.3
on the Egyptian frontier: Hdt. 2.30, Hdt. 2.107
prophetess of Earth at Delphi: Paus. 10.5.5

div2.subhead: Dardanus, a city built by Dardanus
Dardanus(2), son of Zeus and Electra

ul.li: leaves Samothrace, marries the daughter of KingTeucer, and calls the country Dardania: Apollod. 3.11.2
receives image of Dionysus in chest from Zeus: Paus. 7.19.6

div2.subhead: Daritae, a tribe in the Persian empire

ul.li: story of his part in the conspiracy against the Magians, and his accession to the throne: Hdt. 3.73-87
canal made by him in Egypt: Hdt. 2.158, Hdt. 4.39
inquiry into varieties of custom: Hdt. 3.38
tribute paid by his empire: Hdt. 3.89-97
severity of his rule: Hdt. 3.118, Hdt. 3.119
Darius' passage of the Bosporus, march to the Ister, and invasion of Scythia: Hdt. 4.83-98; Paus. 3.9.6
Scythian campaign and return to Asia: Hdt. 4.118-143
transportation of Paeonians to Asia: Hdt. 5.12-15
Histiaeus summoned by Darius to Susa: Hdt. 5.24; Paus. 10.33.2
Darius' anger against Athens for the burning of Sardis, and his dispatch of Histiaeus to Ionia: Hdt. 5.105-107
demand of earth and water from Greek states: Hdt. 6.48, Hdt. 6.49; Paus. 3.12.7
receives earth and water from Aeginetans: Paus. 3.4.2
Demaratus at Darius' court: Hdt. 6.70; Paus. 3.7.8
reasons for attack on Greece: Hdt. 6.94; Paus. 7.10.1
meaning of the name Darius: Hdt. 6.98
Darius' clemency to the Eretrians: Hdt. 6.119
his preparations for a Greek campaign: Hdt. 7.1
appointment of a successor: Hdt. 7.2, Hdt. 7.3
Darius' treatment of an unjust judge: Hdt. 7.194
king of Persia, bastard of Artaxerxes: Paus. 6.5.7
defeated by Alexander the Great: Paus. 1.25.5, Paus. 6.17.5, Paus. 9.40.9
on the Propontis, the seat of a Persian governor: Hdt. 3.120, Hdt. 3.126, Hdt. 6.33
in command at Marathon with Artaphrenes of the expedition of 490 against Athens: Hdt. 6.94, Hdt. 6.97, Hdt. 6.118; Paus. 10.11.5
his sons in Xerxes, army: Hdt. 7.88
battle there between Athenians and Edonians: Hdt. 9.75

div2.subhead: Daula, ancient name for woody places
Daurises, a general employed by Darius against the insurgent Ionians
